audio_description: Hello friends, how are you all? In this video, we are going to see how to make Donne Biryani. It's a very famous recipe from Karnataka. Many people on our channel have asked how to make Donne Biryani.

audio_description: For the biryani, I’ve taken about half a kilo of chicken. When you buy it from the shop, tell them it’s for biryani—they'll give you big pieces like this. Only if the pieces are this big will it taste good. Now onto the chicken...

audio_description: After adding mint and coriander, sauté for another 30 seconds. Once it cools down a bit, grind it into a paste using a mixie jar. Now the biryani masala paste is ready. You can add a little of this paste later too.

audio_description: Grind 1 spoon each of fennel seeds and cumin seeds. Take one bay leaf, one star anise, one cardamom, a clove, a small piece of cinnamon, and a Kashmiri chili. Even if it’s a normal chili, it’s okay. Prepare all of this...

audio_description: You need to add ghee to biryani—that’s what gives it a great aroma and flavor. I’m adding about two spoons of ghee. Once it heats up, add one star anise, two cardamoms, and two pieces of cinnamon.

audio_description: There’s absolutely no burning or sticking at the bottom. Look—I tilted the pot and used a ladle, but there was no sticking. That’s because we used the dosa tawa below. Donne Chicken Biryani is ready—have a look!
